keyFactors.title: Elite Rushing Attack
keyFactors.description: Army ranked top 5 in rushing offense nationally with triple option

keyFactors.title: Tulsa Run Defense
keyFactors.description: One of the worst run defenses in the AAC, allowing 200+ YPG

keyFactors.title: Home Dominance
keyFactors.description: Army 6-1 ATS at home this season

keyFactors.title: Short Week Advantage
keyFactors.description: Triple option notoriously hard to prepare for

quarterBreakdown.description: Tulsa kept it competitive, game tighter than expected
Back and forth scoring, Army unable to pull away
Tulsa pulled off shocking upset, Army lost outright 26-25

gameResults.gamePace: Slower pace than expected limited possessions
gameResults.turningPoint: Army failed on late drive, Tulsa kicked winning FG

whatWentWrong.title: Tulsa Defense Stepped Up
whatWentWrong.description: Tulsa's defense exceeded expectations against the run

whatWentWrong.title: Outright Loss
whatWentWrong.description: Not only didn't cover, Army lost the game entirely

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No - this was an outright upset. Army losing to Tulsa was a shocking result that went against all metrics.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV but result was disastrous

keyTakeaways: Late season trap games are real
Even dominant rushing teams can have off days
Desperate teams fighting for bowl eligibility are dangerous
Army's loss was shocking upset - couldn't cover or win
verdict: Disaster. Army not only failed to cover -10 but lost the game outright 26-25 to Tulsa. Complete trap game.
